channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Persistent trash attracting pests, 11th July
item.description:
There is constantly overflowing and open binbags in this spot. One day it'll get cleaned up and then the next there is trash all over the street again. This is attracting pests, birds and generally makes the street look disgusting.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oldhill Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two dead birds - issue not fixed, 11th July
item.description:
Just got an update saying the issue with the dead pigeons I reported yesterday was fixed. It is not. See my photos just now. Please reopen case and sort the issue. Disappointed you've marked fixed when it hasn't been & no ability to challenge status.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, The Avenue, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge lorry load household waste fly tipped, 11th July
item.description:
Huge amount of household waste - beds, wardrobes etc - left in the driveway next to our house 174 Lynton Road, within the last 7 days. Driveway is Monnow Road and leased from the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynton Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Rubbish attracting vermin, 11th July
item.description:
There are holes in the ground where rats can clearly been seen - not helped by the rubbish - overflowing bin which n turn have created swarms if flies. It's disgusting and it stinks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Sydenham Road, Forest Hill, Sydenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning is not weekly, 11th July
item.description:
Having met with senior operatives who insisted residential streets are cleaned once a week, this is still not the case. Eversley park road is three weeks now without a clean. Its bins are rarely emptied and mostly overflowing. The same is so of church hill where only the bin area is cleaned. Chaseville park road, prince georges Avenue are not cleaned and have not been in a month now. The borough is filthy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 161, Wynsmere Court, Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Could brambles and nettles be cut back on this busy path?, 11th July
item.description:
This is a well used path and good to see the blackberries out for birds and children but could the path be walked and overhanging brambles and nettles be cut back please? (sensitively)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
